metadata.name: New Network Trace Capture Started Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of netsh with the "trace" flag in order to start a network capture

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('trace')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('start')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of netsh with the "trace" flag in order to start a network capture

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activity References: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/canberrapfe/2012/03/30/capture-a-network-trace-without-installing-anything-capture-a-network-trace-of-a-reboot/, https://klausjochem.me/2016/02/03/netsh-the-cyber-attackers-tool-of-choice/
